name: historicity
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being a real and important part of history and not a myth or legend (= ancient story): The two theologians spent a lot of time debating the historicity of the events detailed in the Bible. Tennessee Williams is said to have written "A Streetcar Named Desire" in that hotel, but the historicity of that claim is unproven.
More examplesFewer examplesThe historicity of Marco Polo's accounts of the Far East have been questioned -- for one thing, they never mention the Great Wall of China.Many people doubt the historicity of the story of George Washington chopping down the cherry tree, but the story has survived to the present day.
